ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about various agricultural methods throughout history, as well as knowledge about archaeology.

I learned about the climatic and cultural causes of the neolithic revolution and how early agriculture both shaped and was shaped by the formation of towns and cities. I learned about the process of extensification and intensification that drove the development of agriculture, including such key innovations as artificial fertilizer, hybridization, and genetic modification.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Professor Weiss is a very interesting lecturer and the course material is very important. However, I do not feel that I received clear feedback in the course or that we had enough assignments for me to understand how I was doing. We had two papers in the whole course and nothing else, which was nice when I was stressed about my work, but I would have liked more opportunity to engage with the material.

This is a well-run course, if somewhat desultory in its approach. The course contains a lot of fascinating information, but it isn't always presented in the most obvious way. A stricter, more linear syllabus would greatly aid in streamlining the course.

Professor Weiss is incredibly knowledgeable and teaches to his strengths. The course was a bit unstructured, but the fluidity gave Professor Weiss the ability to adapt to new challenges and improve the course as time went on.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course if you're interested in agriculture, but you should understand that a course with Professor Weiss will be unlike other courses you've taken. He has a very distinct teaching style. I really enjoyed the course, but if you are not good at learning in a self-directed way without many structured assignments, you may struggle.
I would recommend this course; the material was interesting and the instruction was good.

Yes! Professor Weiss is incredibly knowledgeable and a gripping speaker. The material was all very interesting despite being outside of my field of study and it has opened my eyes to the world around me!
